reviews.review_msg: His classes are funny and engaging- he's clearly super knowledgeable and goes on many tangents without being pretentious. Attendance and participation is important. He's one of the very few English profs at SFU that values and welcomes disagreement, and does not expect students to blindly adopt his ideologies. Values good arguments.

Jon is an incredible professor. He truly cares about his students and does everything in his capacity to improve their writing skills and their critical thinking skills. His lectures are participation heavy and if this makes you anxious, I suggest avoiding seminar classes because they are formulated to push you out of your comfort zone :)

Professor Smith truly cares about student learning. If you are uncomfortable speaking up in class, reconsider if a upper division seminar style class is for you. He was skilled at fostering discussion and encouraged participation. If you want to improve your writing, take this class! The readings were heavy, but excellent. I learned a lot.

The class was very reading and participation-heavy, but that's to be expected in an upper division seminar course. Jon always had great insights to add to discussion, and I found him to be a very fair marker with good feedback.

Dr. Smith is an incredibly witty, nice, admirable, and self-aware professor! He really cares about his students. He might be a bit of a tough marker, but he genuinely wants to help his people improve their critical thinking and essay writing. I also loved most of the readings in the course and thought his grading scheme was generous.

Extremely hard marker. He is also super aware of who is participating and who isn't. Also takes attendance very seriously, so try not to miss classes, he WILL pick on you if you do not speak in class which gave me a lot of anxiety. Overall I'm not a fan of him, he also will pay attention to who read the books and who didn't.

Jon is an amazing professor. He clearly cares about his students and really challenges them to learn the course material. While the reading load can be a bit heavy, it is still manageable and an acceptable workload for a 400-level English class. He also selects very interesting and relevant texts, so that helps. Very fair marker.

If you are willing to do the readings and participate in class you will have a great experience. Jon's classes challenge you in a way that will have you appreciating everything in hindsight. It was sometimes a struggle to keep up with the readings amid work and a full course load, but it was definitely manageable. I 100% recommend Jon as a prof.

All you have to do is do the readings. His classes are set up in a way that you will do just fine if you read the course material and attend class. I actually think he is a very generous marker and gives very helpful feedback on your writing. There is a lot of reading and if you fall behind it sucks. Paper proposal can also set you up for success.
